post_text:
Attention Richton Football Fans:

Due to issues related to COVID-19 within the Enterprise Lincoln football team, the football game for this upcoming Friday has been cancelled. The game will not be made up and will be treated as a forfeit by Enterprise Lincoln. We look forward to our upcoming game at Sebastopol on Friday, September 11th. Stay tuned for more information related to ticket sales and game day information.

The Richton School District would like to make you aware of some changes to the start of school as well as a few changes to how the school day will start. The changes are explained below.

We hope that this information is helpful. As usual, please contact the school if you have any questions and continue to check the district Facebook page and our school website for new information.

The Virtual Learning Agreement document is posted below. It is also on the district website (www.richtonschools.com) for you to download/print off. Copies are also available in the school offices.

shared_text:
Richton Rebel Football
July 20 at 2:17 PM ·

Rebel Fans:

As we approach the 2020 season we wanted to share some important information with everyone.

1. Booster club meeting Monday July 27th @ 6PM!

2. We will continue to partner with our local churches to provide pre-game meals to our players and coaches. If your church is interested please let us know and we will reserve the date for you. This year we have 8 available dates: 9/18, 9/25, 10/2, 10-9, 10/16, 10/23, 10/30 and 11/6.

3. We are looking for interested applicants to work in our concession stand this fall. Anyone that wants to apply should message our Facebook page and we will make arrangements for you to pick up an application after our next meeting. Football parents are not eligible for these positions.

4. We are looking for someone to run the grill this year for all HS home games. If you are interested or know someone that would be interested please contact us through our FB page.

Thanks,
Richton Touchdown Club

Richton Band Program
July 18 at 10:48 AM ·

TIMES HAVE CHANGED DUE TO COVID-19 GUIDELINES

Richton Band Program Update: 7/18

Band Camp 2020 Dates & Times

Week 1: July 27th - 31st / 7:45 AM - 12:00 PM

Check-In: 7:45 AM - 8:00 AM
Rehearsal: 8:00 AM - 12:00 PM
Dismissal: 12:00 PM

Week 2: August 4th - 7th / 2:30 PM - 5:00PM

Check-In: 2:15 PM - 2:30 PM
Rehearsal: 2:30 PM - 5:00 PM
Dismissal: 5:00

1. eat breakfast before arriving
2. wear clothes for outside activity w/ closed toed shoes
3. sunscreen/hats are recommended
4. mask to be worn when applicable
5. bring own water if possible
6. check the google classroom for more music/updates

post_text:
REMINDER: Online registration is now open for returning students to register with the Richton School District for the 2020-2021 School Year.

Registration can be accessed through your Active Parent account on a computer. You CANNOT register through the app.

If you have forgotten your username and/or password, you may call the school and have it reset.

You may bring your two proofs of residency to the school in person BEFORE the first day of school.

Registration can be accessed through your Active Parent account on a computer. You CANNOT register through the app.

You may bring your two proofs of residency to the school in person BEFORE the first day of school.

post_text:
Message from RSD Superintendent regarding start of school:

We should have more information about the start of the 2020/2021 school year after the MDE meets this week, but parents need to plan to start back as planned.

There are several options the state and local schools are looking at to prevent the inevitable spread of the COVID-19 virus. We have not taken any options off the table at this point in time. Your child’s safety and the safety of our employees is our number one priority. We are reviewing every single option to find the best situation for your child’s safety and educational well being also. Please be patient as we try to work through this difficult time.

Your child’s safety and the safety of our employees is our number one priority. We are reviewing every single option to find the best situation for your child’s safety and educational well being also. Please be patient as we try to work through this difficult time.

🔴🔴 LOCKER CLEAN OUT 🔴🔴

There are numerous items, such as backpacks, jackets/clothes, shoes, and binders/books that are still in hallway lockers. All students need to come to the school by June 26th and retrieve their stuff out of their locker. After this date, things will begin to be thrown away. If you need help opening your locker or getting the combination, visit the high school office.

post_text: Due to Covid19 precautions, we regret to inform you that the RHS Junior/Senior Prom has been cancelled. As upsetting as this news is, we want you to know that this decision was not made lightly and we had hoped we could still hold this memorable event. We sincerely apologize for the great inconvenience this will cause our students and families. Richton High School remains committed to ensuring the health and safety of our students, staff, and community.
text: Due to Covid19 precautions, we regret to inform you that the RHS Junior/Senior Prom has been cancelled. May 15 at 1:27 PM ·

Attention Parents and Players:

Important information regarding our 2020 season is listed below. Dates below are still pending final approval from the MHSAA and will be updated on May 21st.

2020 Coaches Note and Summer Schedule:

Workouts start at 7:15 on M,T, & Th. Athletes are expected to make 20 workouts over the course of the summer. Jr. High workouts are from 9:15-10:30 on T & Th . If you have any questions fell free to call Coach Rice (601) 278-5500

Workouts start at 7:15 on M,T, & Th. Athletes are expected to make 20 workouts over the course of the summer. Jr. High workouts are from 9:15-10:30 on T & Th . If you have any questions fell free to call Coach Rice (601) 278-5500

shared_text:
Pinebelt Foundation
May 12 at 11:49 AM ·

The Elaine Moser Scholarship was established to honor the retirement of Miss Elaine Moser an educator for thirty-two years. Miss Moser was Principal of Richton Elementary School for twenty-nine years, prior to her retirement. She is an outstanding Christian and educator who applied her intellectual and creative abilities to many aspects of the school, church and community activities.

This year's recipient of the Elaine Moser Scholarship is Kristen Wilson! Richton High School has some unbelievable students and Kristen is one of them! She will be attending USM to study Business Administration!

Kristen was on the Varsity Cheer Team, Beta Club, Rebel Scholar, Mu Alpha Theta and more clubs than we can list!

Congratulations to Kristen for this amazing scholarship!

The Richton Woman's Club Scholarship recipient will be a female graduating senior from Richton High School with a sound record of scholastic achievement, leadership abilities and involved in school and community activities that contribute to improved quality of life for the school and community.

Madison Henderson fits this description perfectly! We are proud to announce Madison as the recipient of the Richton Woman's Club Scholarship for 2020 -2021.

Madison will be heading to USM to student Athletic Training! Madison has participated in Cheer, Softball, Volleyball, Class President, Rebel Scholars and so much more while at Richton High School!

Congratulations to Madison Henderson!

post_text:
As many of you know, Mrs. Gray has been teaching ACT Prep at Richton High School for the past several years. As a result, she receives information regarding the ACT on a frequent basis from a variety of sources. She would like to be able to share information with parents and students in order to help them better prepare for the ACT.

With that in mind, she created a Facebook page devoted entirely to the ACT and any relevant college information. It is called "Richton ACT Page". If you are interested in receiving updated ACT information, seminars, strategies, workshops, or online courses and tutorials, please go and like the page on Facebook.

In addition, Mrs. Gray is willing to send email notifications. If you would like for her to send you information through email, please email her at lgray@richton.k12.ms.us . In the subject line, please include ACT List. In the text of the email, please include your name and your student's name

More details will be provided as I get them.

- Mrs. Johnnie Odom

post_text:
The Richton School District has set the date of June 5th, 2020 for Senior Commencement. The start time will be 7PM.

By moving it back to June, we hope to hold a regular graduation ceremony on the football field for our seniors and their friends and family. We are going to do everything in our power to make this a traditional ceremony and a meaningful and momentous occasion for our graduates and their loved ones.

However, nothing is certain in the current times. If a traditional ceremony is not possible, a backup plan is being developed for the same date that will involve a closed ceremony with the seniors participating in their graduation and a live stream of events for spectators who can watch it on Facebook and YouTube. Details for this ceremony will be released if it is decided that we need to go in that direction.

In either case, the graduation ceremony will be held on June 5th, 2020 for the Richton High School Class of 2020.

Thank you for your patience and please continue to monitor the school website and Facebook page for added information.
text:
The Richton School District has set the date of June 5th, 2020 for Senior Commencement. The start time will be 7PM.

By moving it back to June, we hope to hold a regular graduation ceremony on the football field for our seniors and their friends and family. We are going to do everything in our power to make this a traditional ceremony and a meaningful and momentous occasion for our graduates and their loved ones.

However, nothing is certain in the current times. If a traditional ceremony is not possible, a backup plan is being developed for the same date that will involve a closed ceremony with the seniors participating in their graduation and a live stream of events for spectators who can watch it on Facebook and YouTube. Details for this ceremony will be released if it is decided that we need to go in that direction.

In either case, the graduation ceremony will be held on June 5th, 2020 for the Richton High School Class of 2020.

Thank you for your patience and please continue to monitor the school website and Facebook page for added information.

shared_text:
Richton Dispatch
April 30 at 4:00 PM ·

Next week is Teacher Appreciation week! As many of us have recently realized, teaching students is a hard job, and we're working with just a few. The Richton Dispatch would like to recognize all the great teachers we in the county. Teachers work hard throughout the school year, as well as preparing lessons on breaks and over the summer. Teachers help students work through life lessons, not just classroom instruction. And many teachers keep up with students long after they have moved on from the class. It takes a big heart to step into the classroom, and while they do not expect praise, they certainly deserve it. We'd like to show Richton and Perry County teachers how much they mean to their students and how much they are appreciated. Show your teachers how much you appreciate them and miss them by leaving them a comment or photo. Spread the love and let them know you are ready to get back to class!

post_text:
Caps and Gowns will be handed out this Thursday 4/30/20 from 10am-11am on the side of tech prep. You will stay in your car and drive through to receive your Cap and Gown. This is the only date as of now that they will be handed out, if you cannot make it, send a representative to pick it up.

If you owe any fees (Herff Jones, cafeteria, library, Dual Enrollment, etc) you will not be able to pick it up. (Mrs. Christy Forrest has some of fees owed.)

We are currently working on a plan for graduation. As soon as we can, you will be made aware of the date and plans.

Any scholarships and/or awards need to be emailed to cnicholson@richton.k12.ms.us. These will be announced at graduation. It is your responsibility to send the awards and scholarships by email. If you do not, you will not be recognized. May 8th is the deadline.

post_text:
ATTENTION RSD PARENTS -

As school closures continue and as our state develops plans to direct resources to the areas of greatest need, the Mississippi Department of Education has prepared a brief survey for parents in each school district.

The results will be shared with the governor’s office for planning purposes. Because of the critical nature of these questions – and how the results will shape state policy to address the internet connectivity challenges across the state – WE ARE ASKING ALL PARENTS WITH STUDENTS IN THE RICHTON SCHOOL DISTRICT TO COMPLETE THIS SURVEY by 5PM on Thursday, May 14.

Six survey questions address the ability of families to connect their children to digital learning offerings from their school through the internet. The survey focuses on devices at home, home internet access, and the quality/reliability of that connection.

Below is the link to the survey. If you have any questions, please contact MDE’s Chief Information Officer, John Kraman at jkraman@mdek12.org

https://cspr.mde.k12.ms.us/TakeSurvey.aspx?SurveyID=mlK09726

shared_text:
ACT Student
April 20 at 3:23 PM ·

In this time of uncertainty, it is clear that students need flexibility.

As CDC and local guidelines allow, we will offer flexible summer scheduling and test-at-home options beginning in late fall or early winter 2020.

Here's an overview of opportunities to take the ACT for the rest of the year:

- ACT National Test Dates: June 13 (make up date available June 20), July 18 (make up date available July 25), September 12, October 24, December 12

- ACT On-Campus Testing: Available at participating colleges and universities

- ACT Section Retesting: Available starting in September 2020

- ACT State and District Testing: Students who are testing as part of a state or district testing program should reach out to their school for the status of their testing

- ACT Test-At-Home Options: Available late fall/early winter 2020

Here is more information: https://bit.ly/3anf0jQ

shared_text:
ACT Student
March 16 at 9:10 AM ·

The safety of students and test center staff is our top priority. We have rescheduled the April 4 national test date across the U.S. in response to concerns about the spread of the coronavirus (COVID-19).

All students registered for the April 4 test date will receive an email in the next few days informing them of the postponement and instructions for free rescheduling to June 13 or a future national test date.

More information: https://bit.ly/2QjSC3n

shared_text:
Mrs. Hudson's Class is with Janna Freeman.
March 12 at 7:09 PM ·

We had a “book parade” today showcasing our chapter books from our pets unit. The parade included a “float” about their books and a blurb that was read over the hall intercom containing a summary, question hinting to the solution (ending of the book), and a call to action in order to persuade the second graders in attendance to read their book.

During the unit, each group read the assigned book, completed a “job” (predictor, summarizer, vocabulary finder, or question generator) for each chapter, held a book discussion, and then evaluated each member’s performance of their job for each chapter.

During the unit, each group read the assigned book, completed a “job” (predictor, summarizer, vocabulary finder, or question generator) for each chapter, held a book discussion, and then evaluated each member’s performance of their job for each chapter.

post_text:
RHS freshmen were recognized today in the District’s annual Commitment To Graduate ceremony where they each received a ring and a certificate, and signed a banner indicating they’re committed to graduating in 2023.

Our guest speaker, the honorable Gay Polk-Payton, reminded students of the importance of following instruction from parents and teachers, being thankful for everything they have, and working hard to achieve their goals.
